name: Holiday Inn Resort Nice - Port St Laurent

reviews.text: We had a lovely 4 day break in this area. The views are great (Not at all dominated by the airport as others have said) and the seafront area is fabulous to walk along, there was even a mainly sandy beach part in front of the hotel. We enjoyed watching the wind surfers taking off into the air and never saw a cloud in all 4 days while it was snowing back in Cheshire! The pools weren't open because of the time of year. Rooms very clean and spacious with separate toilet to the bathroom which is useful as a family. One room had a view of the mountains and town and the other of the sea and the hotel gardens. We had balconies in both rooms.
reviews.title: Gorgeous views Loved the location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: To be honest we only booked this hotel because my husband uses Holiday Inn hotels whenever he travels with business so had accrued many privilege points which can be exchanged for free nights. Combined with cheap Bmi baby flights to Nice we thought it would be a great long weekend for us and our 2 teenage boys and my Dad. (Dad had to pay for his room!) We would have chosen the holiday inn hotel in town centre Nice but they did not seem to allow us to have the children in the room with us.
reviews.title: Lovely hotel in Saint Laurent Du Var

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The shuttle from the airport was great you use the courtesy phone at the information desk and the shuttle came within minutes. All the staff were very friendly and spoke good English. We were surprised they didnt have a supply of bus timetables but they told us how and where to catch the bus into Nice.
reviews.title: Below standard

likes.liked: — Good size room and excellent view.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were planning to mainly use the hotel as a base to explore the area but I started with a very bad back and so we spent more time close to the hotel and really enjoyed it. There are lots of lovely restaurants along the sea front We used Dylanos just out of the back of the hotel and to the left for lunch one day and dinner another day and icecream on the beach. It was good value, friendly and tasty. Our 14year old loves mussels so we went to the far end of the port and had an excellent meal in Le bar a Moules great value at 10 euro for a huge bowl of moules and frites. We didnt eat breakfast in the hotel- at 18 euros it seemed steep for 4 of us! We had it in the Cap3000 at the end of the road one day and also bought pain au chocolat and croissant in the Paul part of the Galeries Lafayette food hall and ate them in the room All in all it made a fabulous break for us all.
reviews.title: Good location, clean rooms.

likes.liked: — Clean, well appointed room, good location.
likes.disliked: — Wish you did not have to pay to use the hotels pool/private beach area.

reviews.title: Good location but average hotel
reviews.text: We have just returned after staying for 7 nights at Holiday Inn in Saint Laurent Du Var. What a fantastic place! The hotel is located just 5 minutes from airport. The hotel has a free shuttle bus to drive you from/to the airport, but remember to give them a call and order it to come. The hotel has a nice reception and the staff is friendly and speaks English very well. The rooms are big and very well equipped. There’s WIFI in the rooms but it’s too expensive – 10 EURO for 1 hour.

This hotel is just 5 minutes by free shuttle from airport, and is right beside of of France's biggest shopping centres, Cap 3000. It is situated on a nice well kept promenade with clean but very stony beaches. Do bring bathing shoes! There are some sandy areas in parts, and one area especially suited to children. There is a very joyous well-behaved atmosphere along the seafront, and local people are polite and friendly. They love you to admire their beloved dogs. There is a very good local transport network to all the famous places along the Riviera. Traffic can be immense, but local road manners are very good. Hotel has a lovely reception area & pleasant staff. Rooms are among the best equipped I have come across - clever suitcase storage, free safe, minibar, tea & coffee maker, hair dryer, plasma tv, radio alarm, corkscrew etc. Everything seems to be very new and in perfect working order. The resort area is not glamourous in the "Riviera" style, but it is still very pleasant, and its flatness is suitable for wheelchair users.
reviews.title: Very well equipped rooms

reviews.text: I stayed here with my friend for 6 nights and found it to be a lovely hotel with a very laid-back feel. The Breakfast was excellent as was the level of service. We ventured out to the nearby bars and eateries in the evening and were surprised by the friendly and pleasant service we received.

aka: Holiday Inn Resort Nice - Port St Laurent Hotel
description: oliday Inn Nice Port Saint Laurent is the only hotel of the area built right on the beach. It is walking distance from the shopping center Cap 3000.Holiday Inn Resort Nice Port Saint Laurent features comfortable rooms with terrace, including some with a view of the sea. The rooms are spacious and luminous and decorated with bright colours. They offer all the facilities you may need for a relaxing stay.For your comfort, the hotel features a restaurant serving buffet breakfast, to be savoured on the terrace. The restaurant Chez Panisse is set right on the beach and serves lunch and dinner.Located on a beautiful sandy beach on the Baie des Anges the hotel offers a great view of the sea and offers easy access to many attractions.
